text: A transport museum is a museum that holds collections of transport items, which are often limited to land transport (road and rail)—including old cars, motorcycles, trucks, trains, trams/streetcars, buses, trolleybuses and coaches—but can also include air transport or waterborne transport items, along with educational displays and other old transport objects.The Journal of Transport History, Volume 6, pages 123, 142, 143, 1964. Some transport museums are housed in disused transport infrastructure such as dismantled trolley systems, former engine sheds or bus garages. Many transport museums exist throughout the world, listed below. == Argentina == * Tramway Histórico de Buenos Aires, Caballlito, Ciudad de Buenos aires, ; == Australia == * Archer Park Railway
